profileText: A Representative from New Jersey; born in West Amwell (now Lambertsville), Hunterdon County, N.J., in March 1786; completed preparatory studies and was graduated from Princeton College in 1805; attended the medical department of the University of Pennsylvania at Philadelphia; later studied medicine in Trenton, N.J., and was granted a license by the Medical Society of New Jersey; practiced medicine in Allentown, N.J., 1808-1815; held several local offices; member of the State general assembly in 1815 and 1816; elected as Republican to the Seventeenth Congress, elected as a Jackson Republican to the Eighteenth Congress, and reelected as a Jacksonian to the Nineteenth and Twentieth Congresses, and served from March 4, 1821, until his death in Allentown, N.J., January 14, 1828; interment in the Congressional Cemetery, Washington, D.C.

researchRecord.name: 1813, 2 items.
researchRecord.description: A report and letter to the Philadelphia Society for Promoting Agriculture. The letter is from George Holcombe to James Mease written on November 30, 1813 and covers diseases of horses.

researchRecord.name: In the Charles Bartles Papers, 1791-1905, 38 boxes.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include George Holcombe. A card file index for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Nathaniel Saxton Papers, 1797-1837, 3 boxes and 7 oversize files.
researchRecord.description: The papers include deeds and other business records of George Holcombe. A card file index for the papers is available in the repository.
